intro: Blakwellia rivularis, commonly known as the river blakwellia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. The plant produces small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in spring, and its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Blakwellia rivularis is adapted to wet conditions and has a fibrous root system that helps it thrive in waterlogged soils. It plays a role in stabilizing riverbanks and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
